intro: Mariscus samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Samoa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmately lobed leaves. It produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
